intro: Stylogyne venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan stylogyne, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Stylogyne venezuelana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
